INNER_RULE.NAME: Macintosh OS is Up to Date
Macintosh OS is NOT Up to Date
Macintosh Casper Installed but Not Running

CONDITION.LABEL: Macintosh File Exists File Name (full path):/Library/Application Support/JAMF/JAMF.Keychain
Macintosh File Exists File Name (full path):/Library/Application Support/JAMF/JAMF.Keychain

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {ad_displayname}
The Casper agent has not been detected as running your system, which is needed for access to the CorpWifi system. Please contact the help desk to remediate this issue.

PARAM.NAME: message
PARAM.VALUE:
Dear {ad_displayname}
We have not been able to determine your Casper agent status. Please contact the help desk to remediate this issue.

INNER_RULE.NAME: Macintosh McAfee AntiVirus Running and Updated
Macintosh McAfee AntiVirus Running but not Updated
Macintosh McAfee AntiVirus Installed but Not Running
Macintosh McAfee AntiVirus NOT Detected - Investigate
Macintosh Java Update NOT Validated - Investigate

RULE.DESCRIPTION:
This policy runs on the "Macintosh" group that is maintained by the 1.1 OS Classification\Macintosh sub-policy. All detected Macintosh devices are evaluated for manageability at this stage.
If Macintosh devices are not manageable by CounterACT via either SSH key or SecureConnector, or manually approved via an Exemption, the policy will separate them into hosts with port 22 available, but not manageable and hosts with no management port open.
Managed machines are passed to compliance policies via the "ManagedMacintosh Devices" group.
Unmanaged machines can be restricted/forced to Guest Registration control policies by inserting the appropriate add to group action once control policies are in place and have been fully vetted.
RULE.NAME: (Mac OS OS Manageability)

INNER_RULE.NAME: Port 22 Available but NOT Managed via SSH

RULE.DESCRIPTION: Determine if Filevault encryption is on and if disk is partially or fully encrypted.
RULE.NAME: -- Mac OS FileVault Status
